quote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: When you arise in the morning, give thanks for the morning light, for your life and strength. Give thanks for your food, and the joy of living. If you see no reason for giving thanks, the fault lies with yourself.
author: Tecumseh, Shawnee Chief

quote: Children are natural mimics--they act like their parents in spite of every effort to teach them good manners.
author: Unknown

quote: When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters--one represents danger, and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Most of us miss out on life's big prizes. The Pulitzer. The Nobel. Oscars. Tonys. Emmys. But we're all eligible for life's small pleasures. A pat on the back. A kiss behind the ear. A four-pound bass. A full moon. An empty parking space. A crackling fire. A great meal. A glorious sunset. Hot soup. Cold beer. Don't fret about copping life's grand awards. Enjoy its tiny delights. There are plenty for all of us.
author: Anonymous

quote: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles: find what it is that interests you and that you can do well, and when you find it, put your whole soul into it -- every bit of energy and ambition and natural ability you have.
author: John D. Rockefeller III

quote: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they're not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they're not so bad.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

quote: When you have completed 95% of your journey you are halfway there.
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
author: Anonymous

quote: Remember the mind is like a parachute! It only works when opened.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: I love deadlines.  I especially like the whooshing sound they make as they go by.
author: Dilbert

quote: Nothing in this world is certain but death and taxes.
author: Benjamin Franklin.

quote: The reports of my death have been greatly exaggerated.
author: Mark Twain.

quote: Life is what happens while we're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

quote: Don't take yourself too serious, nobody else does.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Respect cannot be learned, purchased, or acquired; it can only be earned.
author: Bits & Pieces

quote: You can live to be a hundred if you give up all things that make you want to live to be a hundred.
author: Woody Allen

quote: The world is a stage, but the play is badly cast.
author: Shakespeare

quote: Life is far too serious a thing to ever talk seriously about.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If you don't find it in the Index, look very carefully throughout the entire catalogue.
author: Sears & Roebuck, 1897

quote: Imagine if there were no hypothetical situations...
author: John Mendosa

quote: Over 48.7% of all statistics are useless.
author: Anonymous

quote: Too bad that all the people who know how to run the country are driving taxi cabs and cutting hair.
author: George Burns

quote: Nobody can ever make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: It's tough to make predictions, especially about the future.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: You can observe a lot by just watching.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: By swallowing evil words unsaid, no one has ever harmed his stomach.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

quote: Obstacles are things a person sees when he takes his eyes off his goal.
author: E. Joseph Cossman

quote: There are three kinds of lies: lies, damned lies, and statistics.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Put your hand on a hot stove for a minute, and it seems like an hour. Sit with a pretty girl for an hour, and it seems like a minute. That's relativity.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge, for knowledge is limited while imagination embraces the entire world.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
author: Epictetus

quote: There's a difference between beauty and charm. A beautiful woman is one I notice. A charming woman is one who notices me.
author: John Erskine

quote: Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason so few engage in it.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Failure is the opportunity to begin again, more intelligently.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
author: Henry Ford

quote: You can't build a reputation on what you're going to do.
author: Henry Ford

quote: History suggests that Capitalism is a necessary condition for political freedom.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self confidence.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The world is full of willing people; some willing to work, the rest willing to let them.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A jury consists of twelve persons chosen to decide who has the better lawyer.
author: Robert Frost

quote: There are two kinds of people, those who do the work and those who take the credit. Try to be in the first group; there is less competition there.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: In any great organization it is far, far safer to be wrong with the majority than to be right alone.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Life is a continuous exercise in creative problem solving.
author: Michael J. Gelb

quote: A champion views resistance as a gift of energy.
author: Michael J. Gelb

quote: Real poverty is less a state of income than a state of mind.
author: George Gilder

quote: One of the true tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
author: Arnold Glasow

quote: Whatever you do, or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius and power and magic in it.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: No one ever achieved greatness by playing it safe.
author: Harry Gray

quote: Class is how you treat people who can do nothing for you.
author: Geof Greenleaf

quote: Don't do drugs because if you do drugs you'll go to prison, and drugs are really expensive in prison.
author: John Hardwick

quote: When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?'
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: If you don't make mistakes, you aren't really trying.
author: Coleman Hawking

quote: We are most nearly ourselves when we achieve the seriousness of the child at play.
author: Heraclitus

quote: If you don't ask 'why this?' often enough, somebody will ask 'why you?'
author: Tom Hirshfield

quote: There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up.
author: John Andrew Holmes

quote: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: The greatest mistake you can make is to be continually fearing you will make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.
author: William James

quote: The art of becoming wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

quote: It is always the best policy to tell the truth, unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Yesterday's the past, tomorrow's the future, but today is a gift. That's why it's called the present.
author: Bil Keane

quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing. Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Donald Kendall

quote: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: The only difference between a problem and a solution is that people understand the solution.
author: Charles Kettering

quote: People are very open-minded about new things--as long as they're exactly like the old ones.
author: Charles Kettering

quote: In the long run we are all dead.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: If a man hasn't discovered something he will die for, he isn't fit to live.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: You're only as good as the people you hire.
author: Ray Kroc

quote: Neither genius, fame, nor love show the greatness of the soul. Only kindness can do that.
author: Jean Baptiste Henri Lacordaire

quote: Lead us not into temptation. Just tell us where it is; we'll find it.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: My great concern is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with your failure.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool then to speak out and remove all doubt.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Tact is the ability to describe others as they see themselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I destroy my enemy when I make him my friend.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength , not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Winning is a habit. Unfortunately, so is losing.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: There are four things that hold back human progress. Ignorance, stupidity, committees and accountants.
author: Charles J.C. Lyall

quote: Happiness is not so much in having as sharing. We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
author: Norman MacEwan

quote: You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
author: Naguib Mahfouz

quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness, and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
author: Og Mandino

quote: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: A good leader is a person who takes a little more than his share of the blame and a little less than his share of the credit.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: A big man is one who makes us feel bigger when we are with him.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: Learn to say 'no' to the good so you can say 'yes' to the best.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: Yes, risk-taking is inherently failure-prone. Otherwise, it would be called sure-thing taking.
author: Tim McMahon

quote: Lord, grant that I may always desire more than I can accomplish.
author: Michelangelo

quote: Character consists of what you do on the third and fourth tries.
author: James A. Michener

quote: The greatest motivational act one person can do for another is to listen.
author: Roy E. Moody

quote: Evil will always triumph, because good is dumb.
author: Rick Moranis

quote: Freedom is being able to live with the consequences of your decisions.
author: James X. Mullen

quote: Of those who say nothing, few are silent.
author: Thomas Neill

quote: The doer alone learneth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: If I have a thousand ideas and only one turns out to be good, I am satisfied.
author: Alfred Nobel

quote: Remember the two benefits of failure. First, if you do fail, you learn what doesn't work; and second, the failure gives you the opportunity to try a new approach.
author: Roger von Oech

quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
author: Robert Orben

quote: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Ellen Parr

quote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Lead me, follow me, or get out of my way.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
author: George S. Patton

quote: The truth is not always the same as the majority decision.
author: Pope John Paul II

quote: Luck is when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Neil Peart

quote: Necessity is the mother of invention.
author: Plato

quote: Life must be lived as play.
author: Plato

quote: They talk most who have the least to say.
author: Mathew Prior

quote: The whole point of getting things done is knowing what to leave undone.
author: Lady Reading

quote: How do you tell a communist? Well, it's someone who reads Marx and Lenin. And how do you tell an anti-Communist? It's someone who understands Marx and Lenin.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Anyone who doesn't make mistakes isn't trying hard enough.
author: Wess Roberts

quote: I don't make jokes - I just watch the government and report the facts.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Never let yesterday use up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The only man who never makes a mistake is the man who never does anything.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.
author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quote: Being defeated is often a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: Most people who succeed n the face of seemingly impossible conditions are people who simply don't know how to quit.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Yes, you can be a dreamer and a doer too, if you will remove one word from your vocabulary: impossible.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: Love all. Trust a few. Do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Reasonable people adapt themselves to the world. Unreasonable people attempt to adapt the world to themselves. All progress, therefore, depends on unreasonable people.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Tomorrow is often the busiest time of the year.
author: Spanish Proverb

quote: When you can't have what you want, it's time to start wanting what you have.
author: Kathleen A. Sutton

quote: Illness is mostly 90% a state of mind.
author: Hans Luyten

quote: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Standing in the middle of the road is very dangerous; you get knocked down by traffic from both sides.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: That government is best which governs least.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: If you can't convince them, confuse them.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: No matter how far you have gone on the wrong road, turn back.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: I like thinking big. If you're going to be thinking anything, you might as well think big.
author: Donald Trump

quote: When I was a boy of 14 my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one, I was astonished at how much the old man had learnt in seven years.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The human race has one really effective weapon, and that is laughter.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest.
author: Mark Twain

quote: To succeed in life, you need two things: ignorance and confidence.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Don't let school interfere with your education.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It is always easier to ask forgiveness than permission.
author: US Marine Proverb

quote: Character is doing what's right when nobody's looking.
author: J.C. Watts

quote: Find out what you like doing best and get someone to pay you for doing it.
author: Katherine Whitehorn

quote: Everything's in the mind. That's where it all starts. Knowing what you want is the first step toward getting it.
author: Mae West

quote: Expecting the world to treat you fairly because you are a good person is a little like expecting the bull not to attack you because you are a vegetarian.
author: Dennis Wholey

quote: You can't be a Real Country unless you have a beer and an airline. It helps if you have some kind of a football team, or some nuclear weapons, but at the very least you need a beer.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: This is like deja vu all over again.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: You better cut the pizza in four pieces because I'm not hungry enough to eat six.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: I knew I was going to take the wrong train, so I left early.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule which served afterwards to solve other problems.
author: Rene Descartes

quote: Do, or do not. There is no 'try'.
author: Yoda ('The Empire Strikes Back')

quote: Wit is educated insolence.
author: Aristotle

quote: My advice to you is get married: if you find a good wife you'll be happy; if not, you'll become a philosopher.
author: Socrates

quote: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The secret of success is to know something nobody else knows.
author: Onassis

quote: When I am working on a problem I never think about beauty. I only think about how to solve the problem. But when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Make everything as simple as possible, but not simpler.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: In the end, everything is a gag.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other bastard die for his.
author: George Patton

quote: Show me a sane man and I will cure him for you.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quote: Friends may come and go, but enemies accumulate.
author: Thomas Jones

quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Sanity is a madness put to good uses.
author: George Santayana

quote: Copy from one, it's plagiarism; copy from two, it's research.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: I think there is a world market for maybe five computers.
author: Thomas Watson, Chairman IBM, 1943

quote: If Stupidity got us into this mess, then why can't it get us out?
author: Will Rogers

quote: 640K ought to be enough for anybody.
author: Bill Gates in 1981

quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If you're looking for an operating system that is secure and stable, then Microsoft Windows is not the system for you.
author: Microsoft Spokesman

quote: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

quote: The wise judge people by their personalities and not their looks.
author: Ori Dahan

quote: The trouble with being punctual is that nobody's there to appreciate it.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: Do you remember the things you were worrying about a year ago? Didn't you waste a lot of fruitless energy on account of most of them? Didn't most of them turn out all right after all?
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: If all else fails, try reading the directions.
author: Anonymous

quote: As long as you're going to be thinking anyway, THINK BIG.
author: Donald Trump

quote: Cowardice asks the question - is it safe? Expediency asks the question - is it politic? Vanity asks the question - is it popular? But conscience asks the question - is it right? And there comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular; but one must take it BECAUSE it is right.
author: Dr. Martin Luther King

quote: Think you can, think you can't; either way, you'll be right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If you don't like change, you're going to like irrelevance even less.
author: General Eric Shinseki, Chief of Staff, US Army

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Some people succeed because they are destined to, but most people succeed because they are determined to.
author: Anonymous

quote: Don't worry that children never listen to you. Worry that they are always watching you.
author: Robert Fulghum

quote: One test is worth a thousand expert opinions.
author: Bill Nye (The Science Guy)

quote: A small trouble is like a pebble. Hold it too close to your eye and it fills the whole world and puts everything out of focus. Hold it at a proper distance and it can be examined and properly classified. Throw it at your feet and it can be seen in its true setting, just one more tiny bump on the pathway to life.
author: Celia Luce

quote: You miss 100 percent of all the shots you never take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quote: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The proverb warns that 'You should not bite the hand that feeds you.' But maybe you should, if it prevents you from feeding yourself.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: When NASA first started sending up astronauts, they quickly discovered that ballpoint pens would not work in zero gravity. To combat the problem, NASA scientists spent a decade and 12 billion dollars to develop a pen that writes in zero gravity, upside down, underwater, on almost any surface including glass, and at temperatures ranging from below freezing to 300 degrees Celsius. The Russians used a pencil.  Sometimes the most innovative solution is the simplest one.
author: Excerpt from remarks by Robert A. Lutz, 'Boss' Kettering Award Ceremony

quote: Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: If you keep doing what you've always done, you'll keep getting what you've always gotten.
author: Anonymous

quote: If you're yearning for the good old days, just turn off the air conditioning.
author: Griff Niblack

quote: The beaten path is the safest, but the traffic's terrible.
author: Jeff Taylor

quote: Master your instrument, master the music, and then forget all that *!xy!@ and just play.
author: Charlie Parker

quote: The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is inefficiency. An efficient bureaucracy is the greatest threat to liberty.
author: Eugene McCarthy

quote: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
author: Lee Holz

quote: All I really need is love, but a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt!
author: Lucy, Peanuts

quote: Life is a tale told by an idiot -- full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A cucumber should be well-sliced, dressed with pepper and vinegar, and then thrown out.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The bitterness of poor quality remains long after the sweetness of low price is forgotten.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: You can't keep blaming yourself. Just blame yourself once, and move on.
author: Homer Simpson

quote: Seven Blunders of the World: Wealth without work - Pleasure without conscience - Knowledge without character - Commerce without morality - Science without humanity - Worship without sacrifice - Politics without principle
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If you think education is expensive - try ignorance.
author: Derek Bok

quote: May the road rise up to meet you. May the wind be always at your back. The rain falls soft upon your fields. And until we meet again, may God hold you in the palm of His hand.
author: Irish blessing

quote: It ain't bragging if you can back it up
author: Dizzy Dean, Pitcher, St. Louis Cardinals, 1934

quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Formal symbolic representation of qualitative entities is doomed to its rightful place of minor significance in a world where flowers and beautiful women abound.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Habit is habit and not to be flung out of the window by any man, but coaxed downstairs a step at a time.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Know what I pray for? The strength to change what I can, the inability to accept what I can't and the incapacity to tell the difference.
author: Calvin and Hobbes

quote: God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change; courage to change the things I can; and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The bitterness of poor quality remains long after sweetness of meeting schedule is forgotten.
author: Anonymous

quote: If you want happiness for an hour: take a nap. If you want happiness for a day: go fishing. If you want happiness for a month: get married. If you want happiness for a year: inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime: help others.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Man will occasionally stumble over the truth, but usually manages to pick himself up, walk over or around it, and carry on.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: shared purpose, urgency, mutuality, and care ... created conditions for teams to emerge
author: Lewin and Regine in 'The Soul at Work'

quote: The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind
author: Humphrey Bogart

quote: Always do sober what you said you would do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
author: Earnest Hemingway

quote: Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He is a wise man who invented beer.
author: Plato

quote: I feel sorry for people who don't drink. When they wake up in the morning, that's as good as they're going to feel all day.
author: Frank Sinatra

quote: Give me a woman who loves beer and I will conquer the world.
author: Kaiser Wilhelm

quote: I would kill everyone in this room for a drop of sweet beer.
author: Homer Simpson

quote: Without question, the greatest invention in the history of mankind is beer. Oh, I grant you the wheel was also a fine invention, but the wheel does not go nearly as well with pizza.
author: Dave Berry

quote: 24 hours in a day, 24 beers in a case. Coincidence?
author: Stephen Wright

quote: Everybody has to believe in something... I believe I'll have another drink.
author: W.C. Fields

quote: May your glass be ever full. May the roof over your head be always strong. And may you be in heaven half an hour before the devil knows you're dead.
author: Irish Toast

quote: You can't be a real country unless you have a beer and an airline - it helps if you have some kind of a football team, or some nuclear weapons, but at the very least you need a beer.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts, and beer.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: An intelligent man is sometimes forced to be drunk to spend time with his fools.
author: Earnest Hemingway, For Whom the Bell Tolls

quote: Always remember that I have taken more out of alcohol than alcohol has taken out of me.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Ah, beer. The cause of and the solution to all of life's problems.
author: Homer Simpson

quote: Beer makes you feel the way you ought to feel without beer.
author: Henry Lawson

quote: I would give all my fame for a pot of ale and safety.
author: Shakespeare, Henry V

quote: God made yeast, as well as dough, and loves fermentation just as dearly as he loves vegetation.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Drunkenness does not create vice; it merely brings it into view.
author: Seneca

quote: The good Lord has changed water into wine, so how can drinking beer be a sin?
author: Sign near a Belgian Monastary

quote: Beer... Now there's a temporary solution.
author: Homer Simpson

quote: Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Give a man a fish and he will eat for a day. Teach him how to fish, and he will sit in a boat and drink beer all day.
author: Anonymous

quote: There are more old drunks than old doctors.
author: Anonymous

quote: A good local pub has much in common with a church, except that a pub is warmer, and there's more conversation.
author: Anonymous

quote: When I heated my home with oil, I used an average of 800 gallons a year. I have found that I can keep comfortably warm for an entire winter with slightly over half that quantity of beer.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Uncertainty is an uncomfortable position. But certainty is an absurd one.
author: Voltaire
